# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

Here is the function `add_yearmonth` that solves the problem. This function uses the built-in `Dates` module from Julia to extract year and month from a DateTime object, and then concatenate them together as an integer in format "yyyymm". 

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> Dates.format(x, "yyyy") * string(Dates.month(x)), df[:dt])
end
```

You can use this function as follows:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates
df = DataFrame(dt=[DateTime(2021, 1, 1), DateTime(2022, 2, 29)],
               x=[1, 2])
add_yearmonth(df)
```

This will create a new column `ym` in the DataFrame `df`. The values of this new column would be "202101" and "202202", respectively.
